channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. life expectancy is going up. Think how many more news quizzes you can do!
item.description: When the news gets too heavy, the quiz is forced to turn to pop culture questions — so there are a lot this week. Let's see how you do!

item.title: Want to be part of a village? You might need to get out of your comfort zone
item.description: If you've always dreamed of having a village but feel disconnected from your community, try these five tips. Plus: We want to hear from you. Tell us h...

item.title: Kalshi in court over 19 federal lawsuits. What's the future of prediction markets?
item.description: Apps that let people wager on current events have experienced explosive growth in Trump's second term. But one of the leading markets is tied up in la...

item.title: Trump thinks a weaker dollar is great for America. Is he right?
item.description: The president said this week that the value of the dollar is "great" despite a sharp tumble since last year. That may be true for certain parts of the...

item.title: Kari Lake promotes Trump on Voice of America. Does that break the law?
item.description: Critics say U.S. Agency for Global Media's Kari Lake risks making Voice of America sound like a propaganda outlet in her remarks on the air praising P...

item.title: Inside Syrian camp holding wives and children of suspected IS fighters
item.description: Kurdish-run prisons hold about 8,000 suspected IS fighters and around 34,000 of their family members in camps.

item.title: Syria's Kurds sense US betrayal as government forces push them back
item.description: The US fought IS with the Kurds for years. Now, Donald Trump is siding with Syria's new leader.

item.title: Fearing ICE, Native Americans rush to prove their right to belong in the US
Masked agents, face scans and a question: Are you a citizen? Inside Trump’s Minnesota crackdown
Why Iran's response to a US attack could be different this time
item.description: Tehran has threatened to treat an attack by the US as part of last summer's war, and its response could be more dramatic.

item.title: Burkina Faso junta announces ban on all political parties
item.description: The multiparty system had been "promoting division among citizens", the country's interior minister said.

item.title: 1/29: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: President Trump avoids mention of Minneapolis, immigration in cabinet meeting; Sen. Amy Klobuchar announces bid for governor.

item.title: Husband in au pair affair recounts killings of wife, man: "Hoping to de-escalate"
item.description: Brendan Banfield testified that he did not fatally stab his wife in 2023, but instead shot the man who did.

item.title: Lindsey Vonn crashes in final downhill before Winter Olympics
item.description: Skiing great Lindsey Vonn crashed in her final downhill before the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics.

item.title: Dallas native, Olympic sprinter Sha'Carri Richardson arrested in Orlando for dangerous driving
item.description: Sha'Carri Richardson has been arrested in Orlando, Florida, for allegedly driving over 100 mph on Thursday.

item.title: Panama voids Hong Kong-based firm's canal port contracts
item.description: The move follows Donald Trump's previous claim the US was taking the crucial Panama canal "back" from China.

item.title: Remains, jacket found over 2 years after woman vanished in wilderness
item.description: Human remains and clothing were found while searching for Belgian national Celine Cremer, who went missing in 2023 in Tasmania, police said.

item.title: Trump’s border czar suggests a possible drawdown in Minnesota, but only after ‘cooperation’
item.description: President Donald Trump’s border czar says immigration enforcement could reduce the number of officers in Minnesota.
